title: "How Do Emotional Reactions Affect Trading? Tips to Stay Calm and Confident in the Markets"
first_phrase: In the previous text, we learned about the classic cognitive errors that affect our decision-making, especially in the stock market. In the last 200 tokens, the author provides exercises to boost self-esteem and awareness, crucial elements for making sound judgments. The exercises involve visualizations and introspection to remember a time of high self-esteem and evaluate our actions based on it. The author also emphasizes the importance of being present and in control of oneself to act calmly and use intuition, not emotions. Finally, the author advises being open-minded and valuing each company independently, instead of making broad assumptions based on analogies or false guru predictions.

last_phrase: In conclusion, to be successful in trading, it is important to stay calm, be present, and avoid letting emotions like fear control your decisions. Do not make cognitive errors like drawing false analogies or relying solely on the opinions of others. Stay open to opportunities and keep a clear mind to ride the waves of the market.
